block.p: Teresa Alyce Walker and Robert William Ike were married yesterday by the Rev. Cyril Burke at St. Martin's Episcopal Church in Hartford.

Mrs. Ike, 38, is a cost estimator at Hamilton Sundstrand, a manufacturer of engine components for the aerospace industry in Windsor Locks, Conn. She graduated from the Massachusetts Institute of Technology and is a candidate for a master's degree in management at the Hartford campus of the Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute. The bride is a daughter of the late Alice Walker and Felix Quentin. Her father retired as a stock clerk for the Los Angeles Board of Education.
Teresa Alyce Walker and Robert William Ike were married yesterday by the Rev. Cyril Burke at St. Martin's Episcopal Church in Hartford.

Mrs. Ike, 38, is a cost estimator at Hamilton Sundstrand, a manufacturer of engine components for the aerospace industry in Windsor Locks, Conn. She graduated from the Massachusetts Institute of Technology and is a candidate for a master's degree in management at the Hartford campus of the Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute. The bride is a daughter of the late Alice Walker and Felix Quentin. Her father retired as a stock clerk for the Los Angeles Board of Education.

Mr. Ike, 42, is a supervising property agent at the Connecticut Transportation Department, in Newington, and is a member of the Bloomfield (Conn.) Board of Education. He graduated from Morehouse College and received a master's degree in religion from Yale University. He is a son of Middie Scott Ike of Upper Marlboro, Md., and the late Rev. John C. Ike Jr. The bridegroom's mother, who is retired, worked as a clerk in the Windsor Locks office of the Federal Reserve Bank. His father was an associate pastor at the Metropolitan A.M.E. Zion Church in Hartford.
